description: From the verb satisfy, equivalent to satisfy +‎ -ed.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of satisfy

description: From Middle English satisfyed, i-satisfyed, i-satisfied, past participle of Middle English satisfien, equivalent to satisfy +‎ -ed.

adjectives.description: satisfied (comparative more satisfied, superlative most satisfied)

examples: I'm satisfied with your progress in your homework, so you can watch television now.

entries.meaning: Convinced based on the available evidence.
examples: The judge was satisfied that the defendant did not go out with the intent to start a riot.
